visits.text: Singye Dzong is in sacred valley in Lhuentse district, Bhutan
Bt/singye-dzong/ is not a dzong (fortress) but a sacred valley located in the Lhuentse District of Bhutan, near the Tibetan border
The temple in the valley was established by Yeshe Tsogyal and Guru Rinpoche during their second visit to Bhutan

visits.text: Gelephu is a large town in Sarpang District in Central Bhutan, on the Indian border and close to the Royal Manas National Park
Unlike other Bhutanese towns, which are either crammed in a valley or squashed on a hilltop, Gelephu lies on a vast plain
As a result, it's very spacious, with pleasant villas and apartment blocks next to tree-lined streets and surrounded by green spaces
